H0.text: Exponents are used in scientific notation to write very large or very small numbers.

H1.text: Whole numbers are used to write very large or very small numbers in scientific notation.

H2.text: Zeros are used in scientific notation to write very large or very small numbers.

H3.text: Coefficients are what scientific notation uses to write very large or very small numbers.

A4.text: In scientific notation, nonzero numbers are written in the form m times ten raised to the power of n, where n is an integer.

A5.text: the coefficient m is a nonzero real number.
